If you haven’t read the guide for migration to 2025, read it:

docs.revrobotics.com

Migrating to REVLib 2025 | REV ION Brushless

The way to restore factory defaults is to apply a blank SparkMaxConfig. Smart current limit is found in SparkMaxConfig.

codedocs.revrobotics.com

SparkBaseConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

declaration: package: com.revrobotics.spark.config, class: SparkBaseConfig

To persist parameters a la burnFlash, when applying a config object:

If persistMode is SparkBase.PersistMode.kPersistParameters, this method will save all parameters to the SPARK's non-volatile memory after setting the given configuration. This will allow parameters to persist across power cycles.

Thus, you should pass in kPersistParameters into the configure method.

And for idle mode, use the SparkMaxConfig.idleMode method.

codedocs.revrobotics.com

SparkBaseConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

declaration: package: com.revrobotics.spark.config, class: SparkBaseConfig
